medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, cough, shortness of breath, and pericardial effusion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately one month prior with increased heart rate and fluttering in the neck, relieved when standing upright. This progressed to shortness of breath after walking up stairs, increased fatigue, fever (up to 38.0°C), dry cough, and one episode of substernal chest pain lasting 30 minutes, relieved with acetaminophen. Subsequent evaluation revealed anemia and later a right pleural effusion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Intermittent atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia since age 19, with episodes requiring emergency treatment approximately three times a year.
medical_history.family_history: Sister had Graves’ disease; mother had hyperthyroidism.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, does not drink alcohol, no illicit drug use. Worked with multiple exposures to children with viral illnesses. Traveled to Nairobi, Kenya, for a month-long medical rotation prior to current illness.
